page.title: 05MOULTON PARISH CHURCH
page.content: The Parish church of St.Peter and St.Paul stands by the junction of Church Hill and Church Street. Christianity was brought to these parts by St.Aidan from the North. Historians differ in their opinions of when the first church was built.Some say the seventh century some the ninth. This first building was burnt down by the Danes in the tenth century.The engraved shaft of a Saxon stone cross dated 850BC which was found under the chancel when the church was restoredin 1884 and now on display inside the church,is probably a relic from the first church. Another church was built in the eleventh century but this was also burnt down by the Danes. The third church was built in early Norman times and he present one dates from the early fourteenth century.The upper part of the tower contains the bell chamber
